Pulse Width Modulation (PWM)
Stratify OS » Device Interface

Detailed Description

This module controls the PWM peripherals on a microcontroller. More information about accessing peripheral IO is in the Device Interface section.

The following is an example of how to write the PWM in an OS environment:

#include <unistd.h>
#include <fcntl.h>
#include <errno.h>
#include <stdio.h>
#include "mcu/mcu.h"
int write_pwm(pwm_duty_t * src, int samples){
int fd;
pwm_attr_t ctl;
int i;
pwm_duty_t profile[50];
fd = open("/dev/pwm0", O_RDWR);
if ( fd < 0 ){
printf("Error opening peripheral (%d)\n", errno);
} else {
ctl.enabled_channels = (1<<1)|(1<<0); //enable channel zero and 1 -- auto-configures the GPIO for PWM use
ctl.freq = 200000; //200KHz output
ctl.top = 10000; //The PWM period is this values divided by the frequency (10K /200K = 50ms)
ctl.pin_assign = 0; //Use GPIO configuration zero (see device specific documentation for details)
if( ioctl(fd, I_SETATTR, &ctl) < 0 ){
printf("Failed to set peripheral configuration (%d)\n", errno);
return -1;
}
//Create a ramp-up profile
for(i=0; i < 50; i++){
profile[i] = i*2;
}
//now write a profile to the PWM
lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_SET); //this sets the channel to 0 -- since this is a 'B' device the file offset is unchanged by read/write
if ( write(fd, profile, sizeof(pwm_duty_t)*50) < 0 ){ //This function won't return for 2.5s (50 samples * 50ms period)
printf("Error writing peripheral (%d)\n", errno);
return -1;
}
}
close(fd);
return 0;
}

Enumerations

Macro Definition Documentation

#define I_PWM_SET

This IOCTL request sets the channel. The ctl argument is the channel to use. For example,

1 pwm_reqattr_t req;
2 req.channel = 0;
3 req.duty = 100;
4 ioctl(pwm_fd, I_PWM_SET, &req); //write 100 to channel 0

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum pwm_action_event_t

This defines the events for a PWM action.

Enumerator
PWM_ACTION_EVENT_NONE 

no action

PWM_ACTION_EVENT_INTERRUPT 

enable interrupt on event and execute callback

PWM_ACTION_EVENT_RESET 

reset the PWM timer on channel event

PWM_ACTION_EVENT_STOP 

stop the PWM timer on channel event

PWM_ACTION_EVENT_SETOC 

set the OC channel pin to logic 1

PWM_ACTION_EVENT_CLROC 

clear the OC channel pin to logic 0

PWM_ACTION_EVENT_TOGGLEOC 

toggle the OC channel pin

enum pwm_attr_flags_t

This lists the flags that can be set when assigning the flags member of pwm_attr_t.

Enumerator
PWM_ATTR_FLAGS_ACTIVE_HIGH 

PWM output is high until a match and then goes low (default)

PWM_ATTR_FLAGS_ACTIVE_LOW 

PWM output is low until a match and then goes high
